Sure it will work. Cyberlink powerdvd 11 with a simple red/cyan glasses.  Fiddle with the settings so that you get 1 picture instead of 2, and the effect is amazing. even with those 2 dollar paper glasses...

to neo1104: I to have a samsung series 7 3D tv and connect my WD passport directly to it to play 3D films, but due to the format of my Harddrive i cannot copy i file over 4GB, how do you get around this, will reformatting it work? does the TV still recognise it?

Your drive is set to a FAT32 default setting. You will have to format it and change it to a NTFS/PAL setting depending on where you live.  FAT32 only allows for files up to 4 gigs, NTFS/PAL allows for any file size as long as the drive is large enough (this is the default setting of your PC's hard drive.  FAT32 is that of a flash drive.

Hope this helps, excellent quality on my samsung 3D tv through my computer.  Thanks!

Also, TyMod got some terminology a bit confused. Just for clarification, FAT32 and NTFS are file systems. NTSC/PAL are television standards. FAT32 only allows files up to 4GB in size. NTFS allows for much greater size so formatting your drive as NTFS will allow you to store much larger files. Keep in mind that this has nothing to do with NTSC or PAL which are TV standards (NTSC being the standard in North America, Japan, etc.) and PAL being used in most of the rest of the world. You can't format a drive as NTSC or PAL. I do highly recommend you format your external drive as NTFS though unless you use a very old operating system such as Windows 98 which doesn't support it.

For people asking if this will play on brand X TV's. I strongly recommend that you invest in an external box.

Something like to Roku, Popcorn Hour or Boxee Box. There not too expensive (and if you have forked over the money for a 3D TV you are probably not too badly off). Or just a PC with some media center (for example XBMC).

It's also possible to setup a DLNA server that does transcoding.

This is side by side 3D of course. But it's not that you have to cross your eyes. You have to do that on another way. You will have to make your eyes in a derpy way. Many people get confused what Cross-eye and Parallel really are. Cross-eye, it's so easy to understand what it is by understand its name. Cross-eye... think just like a "X" An X can also be called cross. As you see X... think that the bottom of the X is your eyes looking views and all the way to the X's top is the 2 pictures, so that is cross-eye. Parallel is your veiw like this \  /.

TO ALL LG 3D TV USERS!
DTS is NOT compatible if you plug your usb hdd directly on the TV, don't panic, just use this tool http://www.videohelp.com/tools/MKV2AC3 and it will remove the DTS from the movie!
I takes around 20 min to get the work done, but it does an amazing one! Good luck LG 3DTV users!
